description.raw:
Testing with virtual_stix:

~~~
ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
~~~

Calling the service with the default branch fails:

~~~
$ rosservice call /subt/pose_from_artifact_origin "robot_name:
  data: 'X1'" 
ERROR: service [/subt/pose_from_artifact_origin] responded with an error:
~~~

The simulator displays the following console message:

~~~
[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:658] [GameLogicPlugin]: Unable to find the staging area [BaseStation]. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request
~~~

If you only fix the base station name, then you see the following console message:

~~~
[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:669] [GameLogicPlugin]: Robot [X1] is too far from the staging area. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request
~~~

With both of these changes, the service works:

~~~
$ rosservice call /subt/pose_from_artifact_origin "robot_name:
  data: 'X1'" 
pose: 
  header: 
    seq: 0
    stamp: 
      secs: 16
      nsecs: 993000000
    frame_id: "base_station"
  pose: 
    position: 
      x: 4.00014348786
      y: 3.99999559842
      z: 0.131239979914
    orientation: 
      x: 1.66305568829e-05
      y: 4.52010575779e-05
      z: 6.6992448231e-10
      w: 0.99999999884
success: True
~~~
description.html:
Testing with virtual_stix:

ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

Calling the service with the default branch fails:

$ rosservice call /subt/pose_from_artifact_origin "robot_name:
  data: 'X1'" 
ERROR: service [/subt/pose_from_artifact_origin] responded with an error:

The simulator displays the following console message:

[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:658] [GameLogicPlugin]: Unable to find the staging area [BaseStation]. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request

If you only fix the base station name, then you see the following console message:

[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:669] [GameLogicPlugin]: Robot [X1] is too far from the staging area. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request

With both of these changes, the service works:

$ rosservice call /subt/pose_from_artifact_origin "robot_name:
  data: 'X1'" 
pose: 
  header: 
    seq: 0
    stamp: 
      secs: 16
      nsecs: 993000000
    frame_id: "base_station"
  pose: 
    position: 
      x: 4.00014348786
      y: 3.99999559842
      z: 0.131239979914
    orientation: 
      x: 1.66305568829e-05
      y: 4.52010575779e-05
      z: 6.6992448231e-10
      w: 0.99999999884
success: True

description:
Testing with virtual_stix:

~~~
ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
~~~

Calling the service with the default branch fails:

~~~

The simulator displays the following console message:

[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:658] [GameLogicPlugin]: Unable to find the staging area [BaseStation]. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request

If you only fix the base station name, then you see the following console message:

With both of these changes, the service works:

      z: 0.131239979914

      y: 4.52010575779e-05

      w: 0.99999999884
success: True
~~~
title: Fix pose_from_artifact_origin service
